name: Divine Sagely Paladin Arbalest (Paladin 28 / CoT 10 / Rogue 2)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hello ECB!

This was another interesting idea I concocted.

Wisdom based paladin Zen Archer utilising the bonus Great Wisdom feats from Champion of Torm to get Great Wisdom X

Add in some divine damage from divine might & great saves & rogue for evasion / UMD / Tumble / other awesome rogue skills and you have something quite lovely which can be buffed further with undispellable extended Eagle's Splendor / Aura of Glory. With all stats capped (ie Cons / Dex / Wis / Cha) saves are F43 W50 R38

Then add up to 13 casts / day of Divine Favor & extended Divine Favor combined for +5 AB / +5 magic damage and it looks like something simply delightful.

Least important stat being the base AB of 47 (just kidding)

Out of curiousity, spell DC for saving throws cast by scrolls states it is 13+spell level in the Wiki. Does anyone know if the same is true with wands? Running around with a wand of the hammer of the gods with a sky high will spell DC sounds pretty appealing

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Just a possible tiny tweak for you, Orion.

Rather than having both WIS and CHA hanging on odd numbers at level 36, you could bring one to 36 or the other to 18 at that point, and cap the other one at levels 39 and 40. I know sod all about Pallies, so that's all I can sensibly add.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi Stag

Thanks for pointing that the odd number thing out. That is very sharp! I don't like it either, As you know the maximum number of Great Wisdom's that can be taken is ten, and I take GW X at level 35 with CoT 10. So if I make some adjustment to the CoT levels towards the end aiming for even wisdom scores where possible this could make it work better. 

Furthermore I could increase Cha by 2 and drop Wis by 2 to help achieve even CHA numbers whilst leveling, I would lose one Divine Favor Spell cast / day but gain a longer Divine Might duration and damage. Base AB 47 is plenty combined with DF so the build can certainly afford it.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content: What's this?  Another Arbalest for the Archives of Legend?  Your blunderbuss is a bit more min/maxed than I care for, but does this look familiar? The Arbalest of Acheron (gawd, has it been 11 years? crikey).  An evil counterpart to the Divine Arbalest.  There should be a showdown at sundown.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
You know it was only after I wrote this build that Gkorjax reminded me of The Arbalest when I was casually chatting about it. It probably doesn't stand a chance with all the awesome cleric spells your evil cleric/blackguard would have available, and unfortunately smite evil is melee range only. But the saves the build has plus evasion should make my dude somewhat implosion resistant (if such a thing exists)

And thanks for the comment on Min-Maxing I think I should am for a ranged AB of 45 (Mith's AB goal for a good warrior) and try to pump up Cha for more divine damage and duration rather than just rely on the Eagles splendor/Aura of Glory combo. On WoG it will also be able to buff ammunition with UMD which is pretty sweet.
